author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: Assam's Chief Minister, Himanta Biswa Sarma, has announced a significant increase in reservation for Anganwadi workers, raising it to 50% for supervisor posts. In a move towards social inclusion, the state cabinet has also approved OBC status for the transgender community, with identity cards issued to original inhabitants of Assam.
title: 50% quota for Anganwadi workers; OBC status for trans community: Assam CM

author: TNN
description: Air India is temporarily reducing its narrow body operations by approximately 5% until at least July 15, 2025, leading to the suspension of services on three routes and reduced frequency on 19 others. This decision aims to enhance operational stability and minimize passenger inconvenience.
title: Air India now cuts single aisle flights by 5% 'at least' till mid July

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: A courtside incident involving Tyrese Haliburton's father and Giannis Antetokounmpo has sparked NBA trade rumors. Following a heated exchange during the playoffs, talks have emerged about Giannis potentially joining the Indiana Pacers in 2025. This move could unite the two basketball families, reshaping the dynamics both on and off the court, as the NBA world watches closely.
title: Giannis Antetokounmpo trade buzz explodes after John Haliburton courtside clash

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: IND vs ENG, Day 3: Jasprit Bumrah fought a lone battle at Headingley. Let down by bowlers and fielders alike, he kept charging in, over after over. Dropped catches left him burying his face in his cap, but he stayed composed, relentless, and finished with a superb five-wicket haul, a reward for his indomitable spirit.
title: Headingley Test: From Tendulkar & Co. to Bumrah & Co.? India's '90s vibe returns

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Despite Jasprit Bumrah's impressive five-wicket haul and KL Rahul's fluent batting, India's poor fielding, including dropped catches, allowed England to post a substantial 465, nearly erasing India's first-innings advantage. Harry Brook's aggressive 99 led England's counterattack. India ended Day 3 at 90/2, leading by 96 runs, with Rahul unbeaten.
title: IND vs ENG, 1st Test Day 3: Jasprit Bumrah bags five, Harry Brook misses ton, India ahead at Headingley

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Jasprit Bumrah etched his name in cricketing history by becoming the first Asian bowler to claim 150 wickets across SENA countries. His remarkable five-wicket haul against England at Headingley marked his 10th fifer in SENA nations, surpassing Indian legends. Bumrah's efficiency is highlighted by achieving 12 five-wicket hauls in away Tests in just 34 matches, equaling Kapil Dev's record.
title: IND vs ENG: Boom Boom Bumrah! Five-star Jasprit Bumrah joins Kapil Dev at the top

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sunil Gavaskar has voiced his disapproval of the India-England Test series being named the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, arguing that Sachin Tendulkar's name should take precedence due to his seniority and superior achievements. Gavaskar criticized the ECB's decision and urged Indian fans and media to refer to the series as the Tendulkar-Anderson Trophy.
title: IND vs ENG: 'Call it the Tendulkar-Anderson Trophy' - Gavaskar questions naming order of Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Rishabh Pant achieved a significant milestone, securing his 150th Test catch, joining Indian wicketkeeping legends. He celebrated his comeback with a brilliant 134, marking his seventh Test century, highlighted by a memorable somersault. Pant's explosive batting and charismatic presence continue to solidify his role as a key match-winner for India.
title: IND vs ENG: Pant joins Dhoni in elite list, third Indian to achieve this feat

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Amidst US-Iran tensions and potential Strait of Hormuz closure, India, importing 2 million bpd through it, feels secure. Diversified sources like Russia, the US, and Brazil offer alternatives. Gas supplies remain unaffected. While near-term oil prices may surge to $80/barrel, India's strategic reserves and alternative sourcing strategies provide a buffer against disruptions, ensuring energy security despite global volatility.
title: Iran-Israel war & US bombings: How closure of Hormuz oil corridor may impact India? Explained

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: Pacer Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional five-wicket haul gave India a slight advantage on Day 3 against England at Headingley. England were dismissed for 465, trailing India by six runs. India reached 90/2 in their second innings, leading by 96 runs at stumps, with KL Rahul and Shubman Gill at the crease.
title: 'Jab tak bhagwan ne ...': Bumrah shrugs off noise as 1st Test hangs in balance

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Karisma Kapoor was seen offering prayers alongside Priya Sachdev, the current wife of her late ex-husband Sunjay Kapur, at an emotional prayer meet held in Delhi. The solemn gathering took place on June 22 at the Taj Palace Hotel, following Sunjay’s untimely demise on June 12 during a polo match in England. He was 53.
title: Karisma Kapoor joins Sunjay Kapur’s wife Priya Sachdev in prayer meet

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Following US and Israeli airstrikes on Iran's nuclear facilities, concerns are rising about potential regional contamination. While the IAEA hasn't detected increased radiation, experts warn of the dangers from released toxic chemicals like uranium hexafluoride. Attacks on enrichment sites pose chemical risks, but a strike on the Bushehr nuclear power plant could trigger a catastrophic radiological disaster.
title: Middle East conflict: Could Iran's nuclear sites turn toxic?

title: Middle East crisis: US bombs Iran; goes into another distant war

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: The Press Information Bureau (PIB) has refuted social media rumors alleging that the United States utilized Indian airspace for airstrikes against Iran during a purported "Operation Midnight Hammer." PIB clarified that these claims are false, emphasizing that Indian airspace was not used by the US in any such operation.
title: PIB debunks claims of US using Indian airspace for Iran strikes; calls them ‘fake’

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: During the first Test at Headingley, Mohammed Siraj and Harry Brook engaged in a heated exchange after Brook hit consecutive boundaries. Siraj responded with aggression, but Brook remained unfazed, continuing his aggressive play. Brook's innings ended at 99, caught out just short of a century, as England took a narrow lead.
title: Tempers flare! Mohammed Siraj loses cool, Harry Brook fires back; tension boils over at Headingley

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: A Sunday service at Crosspointe Community Church in Wayne, Michigan, turned violent when a gunman opened fire, injuring a security guard. The incident, which occurred before 11 am, involved approximately 150 attendees, including children. Amidst the chaos captured in viral video, a church member bravely ran over the gunman with his truck, momentarily stopping him. This allowed the wounded security guard to fatally shoot the attacker.
title: Terror unfolds inside Michigan church as gunman opens fire - video

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: US airstrikes targeting Iranian nuclear facilities, while initially hailed as a success, have raised concerns about long-term monitoring. The IAEA's ability to track Iran's uranium stockpile is now significantly hampered, especially the highly enriched uranium. Experts warn that Iran's nuclear expertise and undeclared centrifuge stockpiles remain intact, potentially leading to a measured escalation in response.
title: What if US bombing on Iran nuclear sites was effective - and that’s the problem?

author: TOI BUSINESS DESK
description: Income Tax Return (ITR) e-filing FY 2024-25: Those with freelance income must file ITR-3 or ITR-4 forms. EY India's Amarpal Chadha advises that income from independent work falls under “Profits and Gains from Business or Profession."
title: Which ITR form should freelancers and gig workers use? Explained

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Harry Brook's impressive 99 against India at Headingley showcased a blend of maturity and audacity. The Yorkshire batter's innings, marked by resilience and flair, helped England approach a 400-run total. Despite falling short of a century, Brook's compelling duel with Bumrah earned respect and highlighted his game awareness, solidifying his status as a key player.

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Iran's IRGC launched a barrage of 40 ballistic missiles, including the Kheybar Shekan, targeting Israeli cities after US strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities. The attacks, which caused injuries and triggered air raid sirens, highlight the escalating conflict. Israel's defense systems faced challenges from the new generation of missiles due to their maneuverability.

author: TOI NEWS DESK
description: India evacuated 311 more citizens from Mashhad on Sunday. The special flight landed in Delhi. This brought the total evacuees to 1,428 under Operation Sindhu. The operation aims to bring back Indian nationals from Iran and Israel. Evacuation flights operated from Mashhad, Yerevan, and Ashgabat. India is monitoring the regional situation for safe return of citizens.
title: Another evacuation flight from Iran lands in Delhi with 311 Indians

author: NIRMALYA DUTTA
description: In June 2025, President Trump—new term, same instincts—ordered a real-world operation that bore eerie resemblance to Maverick. Seven B-2 bombers took off from the US under the cloak of midnight. The mission: Operation Midnight Hammer. The target: Iran’s Fordow uranium enrichment facility, buried in the mountains near Qom. A site designed to withstand everything short of Armageddon. A site built for this very moment.
title: How Top Gun: Maverick eerily predicted Operation Midnight Hammer

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Sourav Ganguly revealed VVS Laxman's disappointment after being excluded from India's 2003 World Cup squad, leading to a three-month silence between them. Ganguly admitted the decision, favouring Dinesh Mongia, caused a rift, despite Laxman's ODI record. Although controversial, Laxman returned post-World Cup, proving his value in subsequent series, and Ganguly emphasized the decision wasn't personal, as India reached the final.

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: Pakistan strongly condemned US airstrikes on Iran's nuclear facilities, expressing deep concern over escalating tensions in the Middle East. description: Indore property dealer, Silom James, has been arrested by Shillong police in connection with the Raja Raghuwanshi murder case. CCTV footage shows James removing a bag from the flat and installing security cameras shortly after the murder.

description: In Chhatarpur district's Sumeri village, a shocking incident occurred. A woman and her child were allegedly abducted. Sanjay Singh Lodhi and his group are the accused. They reportedly fired shots and assaulted the woman's husband, Hariram Prajapati. Police are investigating the case. They are examining a video of the abduction.

description: Learning to decline requests is essential for protecting your well-being and priorities. description: In a gruesome incident in Nalgonda, Telangana, N Janaiah was brutally murdered by his former lover and her husband. The couple, enraged by Janaiah's continued attempts to contact the woman despite prior warnings and a police complaint, attacked him with chilli powder and sticks.

description: NIA apprehended Parvaiz Ahmad Jothar and Bashir Ahmad Jothar for providing shelter and support to LeT terrorists involved in the Pahalgam attack. The duo has been booked under UAPA, and further investigation is under way.

description: A government school teacher in Maharashtra's Jalna district is under scrutiny after a video surfaced showing him asleep during class. description: Sourav Ganguly wants India to secure victory in the first Test match against England. India batted first and scored 471 runs. Yashasvi Jaiswal, Shubman Gill, and Rishabh Pant made centuries. Ganguly feels India must capitalize on this opportunity. Jasprit Bumrah took Joe Root's wicket. England reached 209 for 3 at stumps on Day Two, trailing by 262 runs.
title: IND vs ENG: Sourav Ganguly warns Shubman Gill - 'India won't get ...'

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Jack Betts, the prolific actor celebrated for his roles in 'Spider-Man,' 'Friends,' and numerous spaghetti westerns, has died at 96. Dean Sullivan, his nephew, confirmed that Betts passed away peacefully in his sleep at his California home on June 19. He was also known for his close friendship with Doris Roberts, with whom he frequently attended events.
title: Legendary actor Jack Betts passes away at 96

author: TOI ENTERTAINMENT DESK
description: Aamir Khan and Genelia D’Souza's ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ has captivated audiences, earning positive reviews and impressive box office numbers. The film has already crossed the Rs. 30 crore mark in just two days, surpassing 'Housefull 5'. The plot revolves around a suspended basketball coach, played by Aamir Khan, who finds redemption while training athletes with intellectual disabilities for a national tournament.
title: Aamir Khan starrer ‘Sitaare Zameen Par’ witnesses growth on Saturday,

author: DIPAK K DASH
description: The central government is formulating a new policy to financially assist states in upgrading their highways, shifting away from declaring them as National Highways. Prime Minister Modi has directed the road transport ministry to develop a model by July end.
title: Government may slow down declaring more state highways as National Highways

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Day 2 of the IND vs ENG Test at Headingley was filled with drama, highlighted by Jasprit Bumrah's menacing bowling. Despite Ollie Pope's resilient century, Bumrah's three wickets and near-misses dominated the game and social media. India's earlier batting collapse, losing 7 wickets for 41 runs, also fueled online humor.
title: IND vs ENG: Bumrah memes break internet as India pacer leads solo charge against England

author: TNN
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi declared India as a burgeoning global wellness hub under the 'Heal in India' initiative, emphasizing yoga's pivotal role. Addressing a record-breaking gathering in Visakhapatnam, Modi highlighted yoga's integration into modern medicine, citing AIIMS-Delhi's research.
title: India emerging as wellness hub: PM Modi on yoga day

author: TOI WORLD DESK
description: In a dramatic turn, President Trump announced US military strikes on Iranian nuclear facilities at Fordow, Natanz, and Isfahan, marking a direct intervention in the escalating conflict between Israel and Iran. The strikes, utilizing B-2 stealth bombers, targeted Iran's uranium enrichment program. This decision reverses Trump's earlier stance on avoiding foreign wars and raises concerns about potential Iranian retaliation.
title: US joins Israel, strikes Iran's three nuclear sites – Top developments

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Tom Brady, the NFL legend, picked Lebron James over Michael Jordan at Fanatics Fest in New York. Brady praised James's resilience and consistency. He highlighted James's present-day impact. Brady's endorsement sparked fresh debate among fans and athletes. This is about the greatest basketball player. The debate continues between Jordan and James. This endorsement guarantees the debate continues and grows.
title: Tom Brady picks LeBron James as basketball’s GOAT; cites longevity, resilience

author: TNN
description: New CCTV footage in the Raja Raghuvanshi murder case reveals prime suspect Raj Kushwaha present at the funeral, holding a shroud and garland. He was seen consoling the victim's father while making suspicious phone calls, raising concerns about relaying real-time updates, possibly to Sonam.
title: 'Had the audacity to mourn': CCTV shows Raj at Raja Raghuwanshi’s funeral - video

author: SAHIL MALHOTRA
description: At Headingley, England capitalized on India's batting collapse and fielding errors to dominate Day 2. Despite a strong start by India, England's bowlers triggered a collapse, limiting India's score. Jasprit Bumrah bowled with intensity, but dropped catches and lack of support from the other end allowed England to build a strong reply, leaving the hosts in a more advantageous position.
title: IND vs ENG: Drama in Leeds! From Bumrah's fire to India's butter fingers

author: TNN
description: India has been actively evacuating its citizens from Iran amidst escalating tensions, with over 827 nationals already returned and plans underway to bring back hundreds more. Around 800 Indians have approached the embassy in Tehran for evacuation, with the total number of evacuees expected to exceed 1,100 soon.
title: Operation Sindhu: 1,100 Indians back from Iran; 800 more seek evacuation

author: TOI SPORTS DESK
description: Pakistan hockey team advanced to the FIH Nations Cup final after defeating France, but captain Ammad Butt's controversial social media post referencing jets sparked online debate, overshadowing the victory. Meanwhile, India's hockey team faced another setback, losing to Belgium in the FIH Pro League, extending their losing streak and jeopardising their World Cup qualification hopes.
title: 'Rafale down again': Pakistan hockey captain Butt mocks India; post goes viral

author: V NARAYAN AND HEMALI CHHAPIA
description: A 22-year-old man from Mangaluru, Bilal Teli, has been booked by Powai police for trespassing and attending classes at IIT Powai campus without authorization. Teli, who stayed on campus from June 4th, was apprehended after a professor asked for his ID. Authorities found nothing suspicious, with Teli claiming he only wanted to attend engineering lectures.
title: 'Came for one-day, never left': 22-yr-old sneaks into IIT-Bombay, stays in hostel; booked
